oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1859 Sharps carbine in relic condition
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This model 1859 Sharps carbine is in relic condition. It was found in the trunk of an old car in the 1960s. The Sharps carbine was the most commonly used carbine by the Federal cavalry and was also used on occasion by Confederate cavalry. The Sharps was a .52 caliber breechloader. The cartridge was made of paper with the bullet in the front and the powder charge in the rear.
